glsa.title: GStreamer: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in GStreamer could allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause Denial of Service.

background.p: GStreamer is an open source multimedia framework.

description.p: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been found in the parsing of H.264 formatted video.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted H.264 formatted video using an application linked against GStreamer, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All GStreamer users should upgrade to the latest version:
